result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin D. Littlewolf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs are payable as follows: $50.00 per month starting on or before July 1, 2016 and on the same day each month thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

May serve in Sauk County.  Sentence to start on or before August 12, 2016 at 5:00 pm.  If defendant is arrested before that date, this sentence is to start immediately.  May have huber for employment or verified child care.  EMP allowed, according to jail rules.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Justin D. Littlewolf
Current: S1067 Little Soldier Ln., Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965 United States  (Effective: 06-13-2016)
Prior: 141 S. Hoffman Street, Hixton, WI 54635 United States

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Defendant plead to the charge.  16TR582 & 583, dismissed but read in for sentencing purposes.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charge he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea. Found guilty of misd. bail jumping, contrary to 946.49(1)(a).  State recommended: 1 year probation, or 60 days jail.  Defense recommended: 30 days jail. Serve in Sauk County Jail by no later than 8/12 at 5 pm.  Huber and EMP if available.   Court ordered:  60 days jail.  May serve in Sauk County Jail to start on or before  8/12 at 5 pm.  If arrested prior to that date, must start jail immediately.  Huber allowed for employment or child care, and EMP if available. CC.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Pay costs @$50/mo starting 7/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Set for plea/sentencing.

Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on May 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Waive reading of the complaint.  NGP entered.   PTC 5/4 and STC 5/16 at 3 pm.   Track 16TR582, 15TR583.  NGP entered on citations by court.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Track TR's.  Defendant stated he did not have a copy of the complaint.  Copy given to the defendant.  Court advised the defendant of his attorney options.  He will apply to SPD.  AIA set for 4/4/16 at 9 am.
